data.title: Debbie Reynolds: her brilliant career
meta_keywords: debbie reynolds singin in the rain
debbie reynolds singing in the rain
data.meta_description: She was born Mary Frances Reynolds in El Paso, Texas, but is known to most of us as Debbie Reynolds.
data.text:
April 1, 1932 - Born Mary Frances Reynolds in El Paso, Texas.

1948 - Wins the Miss Burbank beauty contest at age 16, which leads to a film contract with Warner Bros. Deeming Mary Frances too "old-fashioned", studio executive Jack Warner gives her the screen name Debbie.

1951 - Her song Aba Daba Honeymoon reaches No.3 on the Billboard charts.

1958 - Has a son, Todd Fisher.

1957 - Stars in the first of four Tammy films, Tammy and the Bachelor, and sings the title song which tops the Billboard charts for five weeks.

1959 - Divorces Fisher after he has an affair with screen siren Elizabeth Taylor, who was a friend of Reynolds at the time.

1960 - Marries millionaire businessman Harry Karl, who she will divorce in 1973. In her autobiography, she says it took her a decade to pay off Karl's debts after he bankrupted them.

1964 - Is nominated for an Academy Award for her starring role in The Unsinkable Molly Brown.

1970 - Amasses a large amount of Hollywood memorabilia at the 1970 Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer auction and eventually opens a memorabilia museum in her Las Vegas hotel and casino. She is forced to auction off all of the items – including the dress worn by Marilyn Monroe in The Seven-Year-Itch and Charlie Chaplin's bowler hat – due to bankruptcy. The final auction is held in 2014.

1973 - Nominated for the Tony Award for Best Lead Actress in a Musical in a revival of Irene. (In 2008, she performs Irene in Perth, WA)

1984 - Marries real estate developer Richard Hamlett, who she divorces in 1996, blaming him for her 1997 bankruptcy.
